title: John Osborn (tenor)
text:
John Osborn (born May 16, 1972) is an American <a href="opera">opera</a>tic <a href="tenor">tenor</a>. He is particularly associated with the <a href="bel%20canto">bel canto</a> repertoire, especially the works of <a href="Rossini">Rossini</a>, and roles in French Grand Opera.
He was born in <a href="Sioux%20City%2C%20Iowa">Sioux City, Iowa</a>, and studied music at <a href="Simpson%20College">Simpson College</a>. He made his professional debut in "<a href="The%20Saint%20of%20Bleecker%20Street">The Saint of Bleecker Street</a>" at the <a href="Des%20Moines%20Metro%20Opera">Des Moines Metro Opera</a> in 1993.
Osborn was a winner of the <a href="Metropolitan%20Opera%20National%20Council%20Auditions">Metropolitan Opera National Council Auditions</a> in 1994 at the age of 21. He made his Met debut in "<a href="Salome%20%28opera%29">Salome</a>" in 1996, and has subsequently sung the roles of Don Ottavio in "<a href="Don%20Giovanni">Don Giovanni</a>" and Count Almaviva in "<a href="The%20Barber%20of%20Seville">The Barber of Seville</a>", Goffredo in "<a href="Armida%20%28Rossini%29">Armida</a>", Rodrigo di Dhu in "<a href="La%20donna%20del%20lago">La donna del lago</a>", and Arnold Melchtal in "<a href="Guillaume%20Tell">Guillaume Tell</a>" with the company.
In 2007, he made his role debut as Arnold in Rossini's opera "<a href="William%20Tell%20%28opera%29">William Tell</a>", with <a href="Antonio%20Pappano">Antonio Pappano</a> conducting the Orchestra and Chorus of the <a href="Accademia%20Nazionale%20di%20Santa%20Cecilia">Accademia Nazionale di Santa Cecilia</a>, a role he has since repeated at the <a href="Royal%20Opera%20House">Royal Opera House</a>, London, Theater an der Wien, Opéra de Genève Les Nations, The Metropolitan Opera, Dutch National Opera, Teatro Regio di Torino and his debut at Carnegie Hall with Maestro Gianandrea Noseda and the Teatro Regio di Torino (Italian version). In 2011 he appeared in the very demanding leading role of Raoul in <a href="Meyerbeer">Meyerbeer</a>'s <a href="grand%20opera">grand opera</a> "<a href="Les%20Huguenots">Les Huguenots</a>" at <a href="La%20Monnaie">La Monnaie</a>, Brussels. John Osborn has sung the title of role of Rossini's "<a href="Otello%20%28Rossini%29">Otello</a>" at the Opéra de Lausanne, Switzerland, Teatro San Carlo di Napoli, Italy, and also in Vienna, Paris, Lyon, Zurich and Salzburg Festspielhaus, among other venues.
Further lead roles in French opera repertoire include Roméo in "<a href="Rom%C3%A9o%20et%20Juliette">Roméo et Juliette</a>" at the <a href="Salzburg%20Festival">Salzburg Festival</a> and the <a href="Arena%20di%20Verona%20Festival">Arena di Verona Festival</a>, Hoffmann in ‘’Les contes d’Hoffmann with Opéra de Lyon, Dutch National Opera, and Teatro San Carlo di Napoli; Des Grieux in "<a href="Manon">Manon</a>" at the <a href="Op%C3%A9ra%20de%20Lausanne">Opéra de Lausanne</a>, Teatro Colon Buenos Aires, and the title role of "<a href="Benvenuto%20Cellini%20%28opera%29">Benvenuto Cellini</a>" for <a href="Dutch%20National%20Opera">Dutch National Opera</a> and the <a href="Gran%20Teatre%20del%20Liceu">Gran Teatre del Liceu</a>, Opera di Roma, Italy; Prince Léopold in "<a href="La%20Juive">La Juive</a>" at the Opéra National de Paris Bastille, Zurich Opernhaus, Dutch National Opera, and <a href="Munich%20Opera%20Festival">Munich Opera Festival</a>,; Werther with Oper Frankfurt am Main; and the title role in <a href="Daniel%20Auber">Auber</a>'s "<a href="Fra%20Diavolo%20%28opera%29">Fra Diavolo</a>" for the <a href="Opera%20di%20Roma">Opera di Roma</a>.
In 2017 the tenor won widespread acclaim for his performances in the leading role of Jean de Leyde in Meyerbeer's "<a href="Le%20proph%C3%A8te">Le prophète</a>" in two different productions, one at the <a href="Th%C3%A9%C3%A2tre%20du%20Capitole%20de%20Toulouse">Théâtre du Capitole de Toulouse</a> and the other at the <a href="Aalto-Musiktheater%20Essen">Aalto-Musiktheater Essen</a>.
John Osborn is the recipient of the 2011 <a href="Goffredo%20Petrassi">Goffredo Petrassi</a> Award for his contributions to Italian culture, 2012 Aureliano Pertile Award in Asti, Italy for his portrayal as Roméo at the Arena di Verona; 2014 Premio Bellini D’Oro in Catania, Sicily for his Elvino in La sonnambula in Bari’s Teatro Petruzzelli and Alfredo Germont in La traviata at the Arena di Verona; 2016 "Prix d’Amis" from the Friends of the Dutch National Opera for his performances as Cellini in Benvenuto Cellini; the Italian “Franco Abbiati” Critics Award for best “Male Singer” for his critically acclaimed performances as Fernand in La favorite in Teatro La Fenice, Cellini in Benvenuto Cellini at Teatro dell’opera di Roma, and his Otello in Otello: ossia il moro di Venezia by Rossini at the Teatro San Carlo di Napoli in the season 2016; and most recently the Italian "Oscar della Lirica" from Fondazione Arena di Verona in the category of "Best Tenor" 2016/17 (Awards Ceremony held in Haiku, Hainan, China).
Audio recordings include ‘’Tribute to Gilbert Duprez’’ with Constantine Oberlian and the Kaunas Symphony Orchestra on Delos Records,"L'amour consacré" and "La coppia degli acuti" with wife and soprano, Lynette Tapia, Christopher Larkin conducting the English Chamber Orchestra; "<a href="Guillaume%20Tell">Guillaume Tell</a>" (the complete French version) with <a href="Antonio%20Pappano">Antonio Pappano</a> and the Accademia Nazionale di Santa Cecilia; and "<a href="Norma%20%28opera%29">Norma</a>" on Decca label with <a href="Cecilia%20Bartoli">Cecilia Bartoli</a>, <a href="Sumi%20Jo">Sumi Jo</a>, and <a href="Michele%20Pertusi">Michele Pertusi</a>.
Video recordings include the operas "<a href="Clari">Clari</a>" by <a href="Fromental%20Hal%C3%A9vy">Fromental Halévy</a> (DVD: <a href="Decca%20Label%20Group">Decca</a>); "<a href="Armida%20%28Rossini%29">Armida</a>" by <a href="Gioachino%20Rossini">Gioachino Rossini</a> (The Met Live in HD: Decca); and "<a href="I%20puritani">I puritani</a>" by <a href="Vincenzo%20Bellini">Vincenzo Bellini</a> (DVD: <a href="Opus%20Arte">Opus Arte</a>), "<a href="Benvenuto%20Cellini%20%28opera%29">Benvenuto Cellini</a>" by <a href="Hector%20Berlioz">Hector Berlioz</a> staged by <a href="Terry%20Gilliam">Terry Gilliam</a> (TV), and also "<a href="Les%20contes%20d%27Hoffmann">Les contes d'Hoffmann</a>" by <a href="Jacques%20Offenbach">Jacques Offenbach</a> staged by <a href="Laurent%20Pelly">Laurent Pelly</a> (<a href="Op%C3%A9ra%20de%20Lyon">Opéra de Lyon</a> Japan Tour's televised by <a href="NHK">NHK</a>).
Osborn is an alumnus of the <a href="Music%20Academy%20of%20the%20West">Music Academy of the West</a> summer conservatory program, where he attended in 1997.
